intro: Phyllorkis clavata, commonly known as the broad-leaved rocklettuce, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Phyllorkis clavata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
